page.title: 02Thurnham
page.content: The farms are owner-occupied family farms of 90 - l00 acres, formerly part of a manorial estate owned by the Dalton family. Fields are 5 - 6 acres, and surrounded by dykes (ditches) hedges, fences, or earth banks. It is mainly grassland, but a little barley and potatoes are grown. Silage is the main crop, grown to feed the dairy cows. This is collected by precision chop forage harvesters or forage wagon. Some farmers use additives. The silage is stored in clamps, and either carted to the cows or they self feed. A little hay is grown for the young stock.
